'''305th Infantry Brigade''' (305 Bde) was a formation of the [[British Army]] organised from surplus [[Royal Artillery]] (RA) personnel retrained as infantry towards the end of [[World War II]].
==Origin== By the end of 1944, [[21st Army Group]] was suffering a severe manpower shortage, particularly among the infantry.<ref>Ellis, pp. 141–2.</ref> At the same time the German ''[[Luftwaffe]]'' was suffering from such shortages of pilots, aircraft and fuel that serious aerial attacks on the [[United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland|United Kingdom]] could be discounted. In January 1945 the [[War Office]] began to reorganise surplus anti-aircraft and coastal artillery regiments in the UK into infantry battalions, primarily for line of communication and occupation duties in North West Europe, thereby releasing trained infantry for frontline service.<ref>Ellis, pp. 369, 380.</ref><ref>http://www.ra39-45.pwp.blueyonder.co.uk/infidx/index.html</ref> 305th was one of seven brigades formed from these new units.<ref name = Joslen401>Joslen, p. 401.</ref><ref name="ra39-45.pwp.blueyonder.co.uk">http://www.ra39-45.pwp.blueyonder.co.uk/infidx/page5.html</ref>
==Composition== 305th Infantry Brigade was formed on 22 January 1945 by conversion of Headquarters [[49th Anti-Aircraft Brigade]] within [[2 Anti-Aircraft Group]]. It was commanded by Brigadier R.C. Foot (Brigadier M.A. Carthew from 4 July 1945) and comprised the following [[Territorial Army (United Kingdom)|Territorial Army]] RA units:<ref name = Joslen401/><ref name="ra39-45.pwp.blueyonder.co.uk"/>
* [[622nd Infantry Regiment Royal Artillery]] formed by 117th Heavy Anti-Aircraft Regiment RA (TA).<ref>http://www.ra39-45.pwp.blueyonder.co.uk/infantry/page22.htmll</ref><ref>http://www.ra39-45.pwp.blueyonder.co.uk/haa/page79.html</ref> * [[624th Infantry Regiment Royal Artillery]] formed by 82nd Light Anti-Aircraft Regiment RA (TA), which had briefly (January–April 1942) seen active service in North Africa as part of [[1st Support Group]] in [[1st Armoured Division (United Kingdom)|1st Armoured Division]].<ref>http://www.ra39-45.pwp.blueyonder.co.uk/infantry/page24.html</ref><ref>http://www.ra39-45.pwp.blueyonder.co.uk/laa/page76.html</ref><ref>Joslen, p. 215.</ref> * [[6th Battalion, Essex Regiment|639th (Essex Regiment) Infantry Regiment Royal Artillery]] formed by [[6th Battalion, Essex Regiment|64th (Essex Regiment) Searchlight Regiment RA (TA)]], which had originally been converted from [[6th Battalion, Essex Regiment|1/6th Battalion, Essex Regiment]].<ref>http://www.ra39-45.pwp.blueyonder.co.uk/infantry/page39.html</ref><ref>http://www.ra39-45.pwp.blueyonder.co.uk/sl/page44.html</ref><ref>http://www.patriotfiles.com/index.php name=Sections&req=viewarticle&artid=6697&page=1</ref>
==Service== After infantry training, including a short period attached to [[55th (West Lancashire) Infantry Division]], 305 Bde came under the orders of 21st Army Group on 18 April 1945, and landed on the [[Continental Europe|Continent]] two days later.<ref name = Joslen401/>
